prompts.summary: Asked AI to conceive of a visually appealing active-learning browser game for teaching Big-O notation concepts in a classroom setting, then produce a detailed implementation prompt for an AI agent.
prompts.outcome: AI designed 'Big-O Dojo' — a multi-round game with 5 level types: Classify (code→complexity), Growth Lab (interactive curve matching), Nested Depths (loop analysis), Log Rhythms (logarithmic patterns), and The Arena (boss rounds). Produced a full implementation prompt with game mechanics, visual design, scoring, and technical constraints.

prompts.summary: Provided the full implementation prompt (from prompt 1 design output) asking AI to imagine and implement the Big-O Dojo game — 5 levels, 17 rounds, canvas visualisations, dark dojo theme, belt progression, scoring with streak multipliers, all in pure HTML/CSS/JS with zero dependencies.
prompts.outcome: AI implemented complete game across 4 files: levels.js (402 lines — all 17 rounds with code snippets, ops functions, explanations), game.js (982 lines — full state machine, 5 level renderers, canvas animations for ops counters, growth curves, tree visualisations, race bars, timer, scoring), style.css (496 lines — dark dojo theme, split-panel layout, belt progress bar, syntax highlighting, responsive design), index.html (66 lines — single-page structure). Total: 1946 lines, zero dependencies.

prompt_strategy: Collaborative design then full implementation — prompt 1 asked AI to conceive a game concept for teaching Big-O notation and produce a detailed implementation brief. Prompt 2 fed that brief back to the AI to implement the complete game in a single prompt.
outcome: Complete working game: 4 source files, 1946 lines, zero dependencies. Five level types with distinct mechanics: timed classification, interactive curve prediction on canvas, nested loop analysis, binary tree visualisation for logarithmic complexity, and animated algorithm races.
observations: AI produced the entire game engine including 5 distinct canvas visualisation types (bar charts, curve drawing, tree diagrams, race animations) from a single detailed prompt. The prompt design from step 1 was key — it specified exact level structures, visual design, scoring rules, and file organisation, leaving the AI to focus on implementation rather than design decisions.

testing.note: Developer performed manual testing of all 5 levels, canvas visualisations, scoring, timer, and belt progression.

bugs_found.description: Growth Lab: clicking the chart always recorded y-value of 0 instead of the actual click position. Canvas bounding-rect size differed from CSS style dimensions due to flex layout, so the click-to-data coordinate mapping was wrong.
bugs_found.fix: Scaled clickY by the ratio of canvas.style.height to boundingRect.height before passing to cToY(). Removed unused dpr variable from the click handler.

rounds.result: 1 bug found (Growth Lab click mapping). Fixed.
All clear — bug fix verified, full regression pass across all 5 levels (17 rounds), all canvas animations, scoring, belt progression working correctly.

duration_estimate_note: Session wall-clock time approx 36 mins. WakaTime active editor time: 8 mins.
